alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Kane; San Juan (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 01 at 8:28PM MDT until October 01 at 10:30PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR SAN JUAN, SOUTH CENTRAL GARFIELD AND NORTHEASTERN KANE COUNTIES... At 828 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of dry washes, creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ticaboo, Bullfrog and Halls Crossing. This includes the following highways... Utah Route 276 between mile markers 18 and 34, and a low-water crossing of Bullfrog Creek on Notam-Bullfrog Road. This includes the following streams and drainages... Bullfrog Creek and Hansen Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Dry washes, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
